recipe_name: Sesame steak with spicy green beans
author: Gino D'Acampo
method: For the spicy green beans, heat the oil in a frying pan, add the beans, pepper and onion and fry for a few minutes until softened. Add the garlic and chilli flakes and fry for a further 3-4 minutes. For the sesame steak, thread each steak strip onto a cocktail stick and drizzle over the honey. Heat a little oil in a non-stick frying pan and fry the steak over a high heat for 4-5 minutes, or until cooked through and golden-brown. To serve, sprinkle the steak with sesame seeds and place onto a serving plate with the spicy green beans.
ingredients: 1 tbsp oil,  100g/3½oz green beans, sliced,  ½ red pepper, chopped,  ½ onion, chopped,  1 garlic clove, chopped,  ¼ tsp chilli flakes,  55g/2oz rump steak, trimmed and cut into 5 thin strips,  2 tbsp clear honey,  dash olive oil,  2 tbsp sesame seeds
